Pre-Game Insights: India’s current 10-match winning streak in T20Is has only ever been bettered by Afghanistan (twice).
Virat Kohli and Rishabh Pant are rested, while Deepak Chahar and Suryakumar Yadav are injured.
The challenge now is to arrive at a first-choice XI and consistent bench strength.
Sanju Samson, who didn’t even get to bat in the 1st game, needs to make best use of the opportunities.
Sri Lanka are 3-time T20 World Cup finalists, having beaten India in the 2014 final, but it’s been a steep decline since then.
Injuries have further weakened them, and the absence of Wanindu Hasaranga, their most gifted all-rounder, because of Covid-19, is a further blow.
Even a full-strength side would have struggled to keep pace with this Indian outfit.
India’s top-order batsmen and bowlers are expected to perform well due to the wintry weather and high altitude.
It’s been so long since international games were played here, making it difficult to draw conclusions from previous results.
Bowling first should be the way to go due to the moisture in the air and likelihood of rain.
Ishan Kishan’s strike rate is below what he is capable of but showed signs of talent in the opening game.
Yuzvendra Chahal is now India’s leading wicket taker in T20s with 67 wickets.
Charith Asalanka scored an unbeaten 53 in the first game despite the team getting thrashed.
Lahiru Kumara has taken 41 wickets in 36 T20Is at an average of 24.58.
Chamika Karunaratne and Dasun Shanaka are considered for the all-rounders slot.
Rohit Sharma and Shreyas Iyer are considered for the batters slot.
Venkatesh Iyer, Ravindra Jadeja, Dasun Shanaka, and Chamika Karunaratne are considered for the all-rounders slot.
Yuzvendra Chahal, Harshal Patel, and Lahiru Kumara are considered for the bowlers slot.
Miscellaneous Highlights: It’s still winter in Dharamsala and the temperature could drop to as low as 6°C during the game.
There is also the likelihood of rain earlier in the day and during the game also.
It’s nearly 6 years since Dharamsala hosted a T20I, and a sample size of 6 completed matches isn’t much to go on.
Teams batting first did win 4 of the 6 completed games here, but because they included teams like Oman and Ireland, it’s even harder to draw any conclusions.

Howzat Dream Team suggestion includes Ishan Kishan as wicketkeeper, Rohit Sharma and Shreyas Iyer as batters, Venkatesh Iyer, Ravindra Jadeja, Dasun Shanaka, and Chamika Karunaratne as all-rounders, Yuzvendra Chahal, Harshal Patel, and Lahiru Kumara as bowlers.
The Howzat dream team is just a suggestion, and players may change based on the actual playing 11 announced by each team.
